page.description: Selects first TRUE clause and returns the appropriate value.
page.syntax: Value as A = CASE(L condition_1,A result_1,[L condition,A result]...)

argument.name: condition_1
argument.description: Logical. An expression that evaluates to .T. (TRUE) or .F. (FALSE).

argument.name: condition
argument.description: Logical. Optional. One to fifteen additional different expressions that evaluate to .T. (TRUE) or .F. (FALSE).

argument.name: result
argument.description: The corresponding values that they return. Any type

page.discussion: CASE() returns the value ( Value _1 ... Value _N) specified by the first expression ( Expression _ 1... Expression _ 16 ) that evaluates to .T. (TRUE). Note : CASE() and IF() functions that return a character value will return a string with a length equal to the last string parameter.

section.description: If you wanted to filter records for a limited number of specific values, you use this type of expression, which will examine the firstname field and select records containing the values "John", "Peter", and "Sally".
